alert.note: Alert for Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 25 at 3:19PM EDT until June 25 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR EASTERN PASSAIC COUNTY... At 319 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Totowa and Haledon. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. Little to no additional rainfall is expected from these set of storms. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that are experiencing flash flooding include... Wayne, Totowa, North Haledon and Haledon. The heavy rain has taper off and ended, but roadways, especially the typically flood prone lower lying roads remain flooded. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
